tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE social_media_engagement_metrics (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_date DATE,
    likes_count INT,
    comments_count INT,
    shares_count INT
);

CREATE TABLE social_media_engagement_metrics (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT,
    user_id INT,
    likes INT,
    comments INT,
    shares INT
);

CREATE TABLE digital_marketing_campaigns (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    budget DECIMAL(10,2),
    engagement_metrics_id INT REFERENCES social_media_engagement_metrics(id)
);

CREATE TABLE campaigns (
    campaign_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    total_budget DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE ad_performance (
    ad_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    campaign_id INT,
    impressions_count INT,
    clicks_count INT,
    spend DECIMAL(10, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (campaign_id) REFERENCES campaigns(campaign_id)
);

CREATE TABLE campaign_performance (
    campaign_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    clicks INT,
    conversions INT,
    cost DECIMAL(10,2),
    roi DECIMAL(10,2)
);

CREATE TABLE comments (
    comment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id SERIAL REFERENCES posts(post_id),
    user_id SERIAL REFERENCES users(user_id),
    comment_text TEXT,
    comment_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE engagements (
    engagement_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id SERIAL REFERENCES posts(post_id),
    user_id SERIAL REFERENCES users(user_id),
    like_id SERIAL REFERENCES likes(like_id),
    comment_id SERIAL REFERENCES comments(comment_id),
    engagement_date DATE
);
